{include "affiliate_loader"} ACLU-WV and WV Family of Convicted People need your help with voter contact in the final days of the election. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

With only days remaining until the election, we need all hands on deck to contact voters and help them make their voices heard.

Join the ACLU-WV and the WV Family of Convicted People in contacting formerly incarcerated West Virginians to ensure that they know they are eligible to vote and help them navigate the voting process during this pandemic.

Join one of our final phone banks and help us reach every voter on our list by Election Day:

  • Saturday, October 31 (Halloween Edition *win prizes)
    12 – 3 p.m. (Training for new phone bankers 12 – 12:30 p.m.)
  • Sunday, November 1
    4 – 7 p.m. (Training for new phone bankers 4 – 4:30 p.m.)
  • Monday, November 2
    5 – 8 p.m. (Training for new phone bankers 5 – 5:30 p.m.)
  • Tuesday, November 3 (Election Day! All Day Phone Bank)
    10 a.m. – 5 p.m. (Training for new phone bankers 10 – 10:30 a.m. and as needed throughout the day; join for as little or as much time as you're able.)

    • Please note: These links will take you to a third-party website, facebook.com.

You can phone bank conveniently and safely from home with an internet connection and phone. Join us on zoom during our scheduled phone banks (also available on event pages). Once you're trained and connected to the voter information, you can make calls anytime that is convenient for you or continue to attend phone banks and make calls with others. Make ten calls or 100 calls – it all helps get out the vote!

Please contact Mollie Kennedy at mkennedy@acluwv.org for questions about phone banking.

We hope to see you at one of our phone banks!

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
